channel.title: KevinCTofel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KevinCTofel.

item.description: After a late start to the day (due to a fantastic 6-mile walk with my wife this morning), I just sent the free, weekly About Chromebooks email newsletter to thousands of Chromie's. Join the club right here: https://t.co/b4sZx8wFOc https://t.co/APajVedmsK

item.description: New best cheesesteak in Philly: Chubby‚Äôs in Roxborough, across the street from my prior top pick, D‚ÄôAlessandro‚Äôs. Not greasy at all, melts in your mouth. (Out of towners: don‚Äôt get sucked into the Pat‚Äôs vs Geno‚Äôs trap in South Philly. Locals know Roxborough is where it‚Äôs at). https://t.co/PPCorLBGVF

item.description:
@sivavaid @jeffjarvis Another thought: Hit up a Best Buy and see how you find the keyboard on the Lenovo Duet 5 Chromebook. On sale for $379, technically a tablet with detachable keyboard. ARM-powered so longer battery life and light. https://t.co/VTSLhECD60

@sivavaid @jeffjarvis There‚Äôs also a smaller version at the same price (not on sale now) with nearly identical specs. 11-inch display vs 14.
item.source:markdown:
@sivavaid @jeffjarvis Another thought: Hit up a Best Buy and see how you find the keyboard on the Lenovo Duet 5 Chromebook. On sale for $379, technically a tablet with detachable keyboard. ARM-powered so longer battery life and light. https://t.co/VTSLhECD60
@sivavaid @jeffjarvis There‚Äôs also a smaller version at the same price (not on sale now) with nearly identical specs. 11-inch display vs 14.

item.description: @sivavaid @peterrojas I think that Lenovo fits the bill nicely then. You could spend less but you‚Äôll likely have 4 GB of RAM in the device; more RAM is always better for the ChromeOS experience. This model has 8. Keyboard is pretty solid; at this price it won‚Äôt wow you but it won‚Äôt disappoint either.
item.source:markdown: @sivavaid @peterrojas I think that Lenovo fits the bill nicely then. You could spend less but you‚Äôll likely have 4 GB of RAM in the device; more RAM is always better for the ChromeOS experience. This model has 8. Keyboard is pretty solid; at this price it won‚Äôt wow you but it won‚Äôt disappoint either.

item.description: @peterrojas @sivavaid What‚Äôs your budget and use case(s)? I typically drop $700 - $1000 on a Chromebook for higher end specs to code in the Linux container. But you can get a solid ‚Äúeveryday‚Äù basic use device for around $400. Good example that I like: https://t.co/FdPJRuOpKV
item.source:markdown: @peterrojas @sivavaid What‚Äôs your budget and use case(s)? I typically drop $700 - $1000 on a Chromebook for higher end specs to code in the Linux container.
